DOC.brief_summary: This study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of dexamethasone (OZURDEX®) as adjunctive therapy to ranibizumab (LUCENTIS®) compared with ranibizumab alone in the treatment of patients with choroidal neovascularization secondary to age-related macular degeneration
DOC.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Dexamethasone as Adjunctive Therapy to Ranibizumab in Subjects With Choroidal Neovascularization and Age-Related Macular Degeneration
DOC.criteria: Received at least 2 and no more than 3 monthly Lucentis or Avastin injections Last Lucentis or Avastin was injected approximately 4 weeks prior to screening Visual acuity between 20/320 and 20/40 Active ocular infection Contraindication to pupil dilation in either eye Eye surgery including cataract surgery and/or laser of any type within 3 months
